intro: Stylocline amphibola, commonly known as the rock hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and large, showy flowers that typically range in color from white to pink. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often growing in rocky or coastal areas. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and landscapes.
